oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effects of varying tilt angle of halo implant on the performance of sub 100nm LAC MOSFETs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SARKAR, P
MALLIK, A
SARKAR, CK
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mosfet
ion implantation
semiconductor device models
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper we systematically investigate the effects of the varying tilt angle of the halo implants on the different device performance parameters of 100 nm lateral asymmetric channel (LAC) MOSFETs. The tilt angle is varied from 5deg to 60deg with twist angle 0deg. Substantial reduction of sub-threshold swing is found for large tilt angles as compared to low angles of halo implant. The device structure, known as lateral asymmetric channel with large angle tilt implant (LACLATI), exhibits better reverse short channel effect and I on/Ioff, and lower junction capacitance.
